pageContent: Purpose of review: As all new treatment modalities nonablative thermal therapy for minimal invasive treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia should be critically analyzed. This review discusses the literature to identify the merits of these so-called minimally invasive treatments and the place they should take in the armamentarium of benign prostatic hyperplasia therapy options.

metaData.source:
Escherichia coli bloodstream infection after transrectal ultrasound-guided prostate biopsy: our experience in North West London
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23087390/
